- Prevents extreme poverty (which the range constraint does by setting limits)
- Prevents extreme inequality (which creates social instability and reduces overall welfare)
- Still maintains incentives for productivity and innovation (which it does by allowing some inequality within bounds)
- Balances efficiency with equity
